WorkItem.Description:
Currently there's a sort of bug for Elemental Precision in the Frost Tree for mages that it's giving 2% to hit for Frostbolt rather than the listed 1%.
 
A quick explanation can be found at:
 
http://spicytunas.com/?p=627
 
Although a quick Google search will dig up plenty of hits.
 
It's probably technically a bug but it's been live for so long I doubt it will be fixed.
 
Since I  get 3% from this ghost hit, Rawr thinks I'm under hitcap and is overweighting items with spellhit.
 
Could you add a checkbox on the Options screen to allow for ghost hit?

Comments.Message: Ghost hit is calculated in Rawr.mage. To see this, in the stats tab, under Spell Info is a list of spells. Hang your mouse over the dps rating for Frostbolt. You'll see the calculated hit rate for this spell, which should be showing 99%. If it's not, then you are indeed under cap.

Ah, OK. Is it included in the gear comparison section as well?

 It seems to be telling me items with more spellhit are better for me than my current gear, which seems odd since my current gear is equal and some times has more spelldmg and other stats than these spellhit items (Anetheron's Noose over Waistwrap of Infinity, Slippers of the Seacaller over Footpads of Madness, a few others.)

Thanks.
You're probably missing your meta bonus. Those items have gems which give you your meta, making them worth more.

I'm wearing the Cowl of the Grand Engineer. Doesn't even have a meta slot.

http://www.wowarmory.com/character-sheet.xml?r=Kirin+Tor&n=Prosperoh

Trinket listed in Rawr is Crusader Darkmoon card, but other than that, that's what I have.

You have 9.04% spellhit, so you are under cap. It's not at all surprising that you will do more dps with, for example, Belt of Blasting instead of your current belt.

Incidentally, neither Antheron's Noose nor Slippers of the Seacaller have spellhit.

I think you're using the wrong hitcap amount Misanthrope. Melee classes have a 9% cap (for single-wielding). But mages have a 16% cap (17% miss chance, last 1% can't be overcome). You are quite a long distance below the hitcap... a frost mage needs 124 +spell hit to reach the hit cap against raid bosses.

Read more about hitcap here: http://www.tankspot.com/forums/tankspot-library/36361-guide-hit-rating-spell-hit-expertise.html
